props.synopsis: The 57-year-old has pleaded not guilty to the alleged murders of Carol Clay and Russell Hill and will give evidence on Thursday.

image.altText: A black and white photo of Daryl Somers and John Blackman dressed up in suits.

props.synopsis: Radio and television star John Blackman has died at the age of 76. He was well known for his voiceover work on Channel Nine's Hey Hey It's Saturday program.

title.children: Hey Hey host Daryl Somers pays tribute to 'beloved friend' John Blackman after death at 76

image.altText: A woman smiling and taking a selfie

props.synopsis: Hannah McGuire was found dead near Ballarat in April, with more than $60,000 raised on GoFundMe in the days following.

title.children: Police charge man over alleged theft of fundraising money donated to family of Hannah McGuire

image.altText: Composite of Ben Hunt, Tom Dearden and Joseph Sua'ali'i

props.synopsis: The Maroons claim bragging rights after defeating the Blues 38-10 in the State of Origin opener, but their win didn't come without a spot of controversy. Here's five quick hits from State of Origin I in Sydney.

title.children: Five quick hits â€” Sua'ali'i given his marching orders on Origin debut as Hunt stands tall for Maroons

image.altText: Joseph-Aukuso Sua'ali'i is sent off

props.synopsis: New South Wales's new era gets off to a shocking start, with Joseph Sua'a'li'i sent off after just eight minutes following a dramatic high hit on Queensland fullback Reece Walsh in State of Origin Game I at Sydney's Olympic stadium.

title.children: Debutant's stunning send-off leaves NSW hamstrung as Maroons dominate Origin opener

image.altText: A white van carrying Armaguard's badge logo stationary in a parking lot.

props.synopsis: Armaguard is facing a new investigation by the competition watchdog, as it comes under intense scrutiny over its troubled monopoly on cash transportation around the country.

title.children: Cash crisis gets messy, with fresh ACCC scrutiny of troubled Armaguard

image.altText: A woman surrounded by cameras, crying.

props.synopsis: The Italian court found Knox wrongly accused an innocent man, the Congolese owner of the bar where she worked part time, of the 2007 killing.Â

title.children: Amanda Knox re-convicted in Italian slander case after prior exoneration for 2007 murder of roommate

image.altText: King Charles holds and hand to his eye as he tears up

props.synopsis: The 75-year-old monarch, who recently resumed public engagements, is expected to meet with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and US president Joe Biden in France for the WWII anniversary.

title.children: King Charles heads D-Day's 80th anniversary commemorations before first international trip since cancer diagnosis

image.altText: albo bandt dutton

props.synopsis: The government and the opposition have joined together in parliament to condemn Greens members' involvement in pro-Palestinian protests, accusing the party of inflaming tensions over social cohesion.Â

title.children: 'I will not be lectured about peace and non-violence': Bipartisan condemnation of Greens' involvement in pro-Palestinian protests

image.altText: A middle aged woman with a light brown bob and glasses speaks in front of small microphones mounted on a desk.

props.synopsis: The Reserve Bank of Australia's governor says the federal government's proposed $300 energy bill relief will not have a "material" impact on reducing inflation, but is also unlikely to make inflation worse.

title.children: RBA governor says $300 energy bill relief is unlikely to impact inflation

image.altText: Unidentified person typing on computer keyboard in darkened room.

props.synopsis: The health company at the centre of a recent cyber attack has gone into administration, just weeks after it asked the federal government for a bailout.

title.children: MediSecure in administration just weeks after confirming large cyber attack

image.altText: Corporate grey office building and ABC logo

props.synopsis: A staff survey at ABC News has found bullying is a "pervasive" issue in the workplace, especially for women, who also experience higher rates of sexual harassment at work.

title.children: ABC News staff survey reveals one in four respondents experienced workplace bullying, one in 10 were sexually harrassed

image.altText: Two wedding bands resting on a book.

props.synopsis: Antoinette and her wife are joining a growing number of Australians seekingÂ "prenups". Lawyers say the harsh economic climate and growing number of parents giving children money is driving more people to consider them.

title.children: Why lawyers say the 'bank of mum and dad' is driving demand for Australia's version of a prenup

image.altText: Prime Minister Narendra Modi greets supporters as he arrives at Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) headquarters in New Delhi, India.

title.children: Modi has won a third term. Here are five quick questions about the Indian election

image.altText: A person holds an iPhone in their right hand showing an Afterpay balance in a shopping centre with escalators in the background.

props.synopsis: Buy now, pay later providers such as Afterpay and Zip may soon have to hold credit licences and ensure their customers can afford their services under new regulations introduced by the federal government.

title.children: Users of buy now, pay later services to undergo credit checks under proposed new law

image.altText: Workers stand near survey equipment in a bare paddock.

props.synopsis: The tiny western Victorian town of Minyip could soon host one of the world's largest rare earth mines after a multi-million dollar funding injection from a US uranium giant.

title.children: American uranium giant to fund rare earth mine in Victoria

image.altText: A close up of a blonde woman smiling, looking to the left.

title.children: Paris Hilton, CNN among high-profile TikTok accounts targeted in cyber attack

image.altText: Shoppers walk through Pitt Street Mall

title.children: Australia 'teetering on the brink of recession' as economy barely grows

image.altText: A man stands in an alleyway.

props.synopsis: The Australian Information Commissioner is suing Medibank over a 2022 hack that leaked sensitive data about millions of Australians.

title.children: Medibank legal case a 'wake-up' call for Australian businesses

image.altText: Two smiling young women, dressed for warmth, stand near a house.

title.children: Floods have left Lismore a 'ghost town' â€” now squatters are seeking out its empty homes

title.children: There are 23 butchers in Tom's family â€” he hopes to do them proud at the 'Meat Olympics'

image.altText: A screenshot of a man next to a pillar on which toilet has been spray painted.

props.synopsis: A Japanese celebrity plastic surgeon puts a bounty on the head of a Chinese vlogger who sparked outrage by urinating and spray-painting "toilet" at Tokyo's controversial Yasukuni Shrine.Â

title.children: Plastic surgeon offers $100,000 bounty for man who defaced and urinated on Japanese war shrine

image.altText: Man smiling and looking at the camera.

props.synopsis: Singer Kamahl is accused of intimidating a woman over a loan the TV personality's lawyer says he gave her.

title.children: TV personality Kamahl to apply to have intimidation charge dismissed on mental health grounds

image.altText: A brunette woman in a dark top smiling

props.synopsis: A Latrobe City councillor who was ordered to apologise after sharing anti-trans content says "political activists have gone too far".

title.children: A local councillor ignored a directive to apologise for her anti-trans tweets. Now she's suspended

image.altText: Bearded man wearing suit eats apple in front of retro court building.

props.synopsis: A Tasmanian man representing himself in court over allegations of domestic violence against his then-wife has cross-examined his own psychologist, who first alerted police to the incident.

title.children: Man representing himself in family violence trial bills psychologist for 'fair amount' of $10k an hour

image.altText: A woman wearing glasses looks ahead.

props.synopsis: South Australia's Commissioner for Aboriginal Children and Young People says First Nations children's rights are being "trampled on" by what she describes as a "institutionally racist" child protection system.

title.children: Aboriginal children face 'institutionally racist' SA child protection system, report finds

image.altText: A toddler smiles at his mum. His face is covered in chocolate ice cream

props.synopsis: A toddler who drowned in a dam on a property at Lara, near Geelong in Victoria, has been remembered as a "cheeky" child who had a gift with animals.

title.children: Family mourns 'cheeky' toddler after dam drowning near Geelong

image.altText: Four people stand around a video game installation looking down at the screen

props.synopsis: The Freeplay Independent Games Festival is celebrating its 20th year of hosting the who's who of gaming in Melbourne. Organisers say keeping independence and creativity in games is more important than ever.Â

title.children: 'I didn't know video games could be like this': How Freeplay champions gaming like a writers' festival

image.altText: a man in a suit walking out of a building with a mother and father covering their faces

title.children: Judge grants bail to alleged teen terrorist, branding case 'thin' in bruising ruling for AFP

image.altText: A view of the side of a mountain with a part fallen off

props.synopsis: Under a mountain, a remote community quietly slept. Then a sudden landslide levelled a village.

title.children: A remote community slept under a mountain. Overnight it was levelled

image.altText: Australian cricketer Pat Cummins looks lost in thought as he sits at a training session.

title.children: Cummins the Unicorn: Australia's Test captain signs shock deal with San Francisco T20 side

image.altText: A view of sign board warning of extreme heat in Death Valley, California

props.synopsis: As the world hits an alarming climate milestone, a new report by a US research team shows the staggering amount of extreme heat days each country experienced last year, with the majority made more likely by human-induced climate change.

title.children: One country had 18 times more dangerous heat days in a year as the world marks an unfortunate milestone

image.altText: A man sits cross-legged on a red couch and looks down at his phone with a serious expression on his face.

props.synopsis: While striking a balance between moderating our exposure and staying informed about the world around us is important, experts say learning to sit with discomfort can lead to growth and resilience.

title.children: 'A sign your humanity is intact': What to do with the feelings distressing Israel-Gaza coverage ignites
